text: John Albert Johnson was an American Democratic Party politician who served as governor of Minnesota from 1905 to 1909. His time in office was notable for the passage of a wide range of social progressive reforms.Title: November 1909 : Bulletin of the United States Bureau of Labor, No. 85, Volume XIX, P.641-648John A. Johnson THE PEOPLE’S GOVERNOR A Political Biography by WINIFRED G. HELMES, P.212John A. Johnson THE PEOPLE’S GOVERNOR A Political Biography by WINIFRED G. HELMES, P.294 ==References== Category:Governors of Minnesota Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: John Albert Johnson
